article.title: A Baer-Krull theorem for quasi-ordered groups

multiple_choice_question.text: Theorem 0.1 provides conditions for a valuation on a quasi-ordered field to be:
According to Theorem 0.1, which of the following is NOT equivalent to the valuation *v* being compatible with the quasi-order ≤?
choices: ≤ induces a q.o on the residue field *R<sub>v</sub>/I<sub>v</sub>*.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of Theorem 0.1, what does *R<sub>v</sub>* represent?
choices: The value group of the valuation *v*.
The residue field of the valuation *v*.
The maximal ideal of the valuation ring of *v*.
The set of all ≤-convex subsets of *K*.

multiple_choice_question.text: Theorem 0.1 can be used to characterize:
choices: The existence of an order on a valued field.
The coarsening of one valuation by another.
The algebraic closure of a quasi-ordered field.
The value group of a composition of valuations.
